title: Man Killed In Leopard Attack In Uttarakhand, Nearby Schools Shut For 2 Days
content: A 45-year-old man was killed in a leopard attack in this Uttar Pradesh district on Thursday, prompting the administration to order the shooting of the animal and declare a two-day holiday for schools in the area, officials said.

title: 2 BRS Local-Body Poll Candidates Die By Suicide In Telangana
content: In two separate incidents reported from Telangana, the two BRS Party candidates contesting in the upcoming local-body elections were found dead by hanging in Nirmal and Nalgonda districts, police said on Thursday.

title: Warrant Against Sheikh Hasina's Son Over 2024 Bangladesh Protests
content: Bangladesh's International Crime Tribunal (ICT) on Thursday has issued an arrest warrant against Sajeeb Wazed Joy, son of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

title: Hong Kong Removes Construction Netting After Deadly Fire That Killed 159
content: Workers began removing protective netting from construction sites across Hong Kong on Thursday to comply with a government order after the city's deadliest fire in decades.

title: Congress Seeks Larger Role, Asks DMK To Finalise Tamil Nadu Seat Sharing By December 15
content: Undeterred by the setback in Bihar, where it won only six of the 61 seats it contested, the Congress has toughened its position during talks with key ally DMK in Tamil Nadu during their latest meeting, sources have said.

title: Nirmala Sitharaman Moves Health Security Bill, Links It To National Security
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday moved The Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025 in Lok Sabha for consideration and passing in the Lok Sabha.

title: IndiGo To Cancel More Flights For 2-3 Days, Seeks Rules Exemption Till Feb 10
content: IndiGo has sought exemptions for pilot rest and duty norms till February 10, 2026, related to its night duty flights for its A320 fleet.

title: PM Modi's Warm Welcome For Putin: Hug, Handshake, Carpool Ride: 10 Points
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin landed in New Delhi on Thursday evening for a 27-hour visit that India views as a reaffirmation of one of its oldest and most resilient strategic partnerships in the world.

title: Putin India Visit LIVE Updates: PM Modi Hosts Private Dinner For Putin Ahead Of India-Russia Summit
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is in India for his two-day state visit. The Russian delegation will hold discussions on cooperation in areas such as trade, economy, science, technology, and culture.

title: Porn Site Fined 1 Million Pounds For Failing To Check Age Of Users In UK
content: Britain's media watchdog on Thursday slapped a 1 million pounds ($1.3 million) fine on a company for failing to ensure robust age checks on its 18 pornography websites.

title: Maternal Mortality In Delhi Down From 0.55 In 2019 To 0.44 In 2024: Report
content: The Maternal Mortality Ratio (MMR) in Delhi has marginally declined from 0.55 in 2019 to 0.44 in 2024, according to a report.

title: 'Illegal Migrants Claiming Our Ancestral Lands As Their Own': 4 Naga Tribes In Manipur Raise Alarm, Write To PM
content: The Joint Tribes Council Manipur, representing four Naga tribes, has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to take "urgent action" to curb what it termed unchecked illegal migration into the state.

title: Karnataka Cabinet Okays Hate Speech Bill, Stringent Punishment Proposed
content: A landmark bill to control hate speech and hate crimes got the green light from the Karnataka cabinet today, paving the way for its introduction in the State Legislature.

title: Woman, 31, Dies By Suicide By Jumping From High-Rise In Mumbai: Cops
content: A 31-year-old woman allegedly committed suicide by jumping from a high-rise in Mumbai's Jogeshwari area, a police official said on Thursday.

title: Law Commission Told House Panel One Nation, One Poll Is Constitutionally Sound: Sources
content: The Law Commission has informed the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) meeting on One Nation, One Election that the proposed legislation does not violate the basic structure of the Constitution, sources have told NDTV.

title: 'Mamata Banerjee Will Be Ex-Chief Minister In 2026': MLA Humayun Kabir
content: Suspended Trinamool Congress MLA Humayun Kabir on Thursday escalated his attack on West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, declaring that she will no longer remain in power after the 2026 Assembly elections.

title: "Russia Is India's Strategic Partner In Technology Defence": Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday said that Russia remains India's strategic partner in technology and defence despite the recent geopolitical developments.

title: These five Giannis blockbusters would rock the NBA title race
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo paired with Steph Curry? Kevin Durant? Victor Wembanyama?! NBA insiders break down five deals the Bucks could consider.

title: Slay not reporting to Bills as he mulls NFL future
content: Darius Slay, who was claimed by the Bills on waivers Wednesday, is unsure if he wants to continue playing and will not be reporting to Buffalo.

title: Sources: Giannis (calf strain) out 2 to 4 weeks
content: Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo is expected to be sidelined for approximately two to four weeks with a right calf strain, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: AD disputes Kiffin's version of exit from Ole Miss
content: Ole Miss athletic director Keith Carter is disputing Lane Kiffin's version of events surrounding the coach's controversial exit for LSU.

title: Gray: With BoSox, 'It's easy to hate the Yankees'
content: Sonny Gray, now with the Red Sox, says he is happy to be in "a place where it's easy to hate the Yankees."

title: Siena lacrosse coach Gleason, 41, dies after fall
content: Siena men's lacrosse coach Liam Gleason has died, the school announced Wednesday, three days after he suffered a traumatic brain injury in a fall at his home. He was 41.

title: Harden 'just as shocked as you guys' by CP3 exit
content: Clippers stars Kawhi Leonard and James Harden said they were "shocked" when they learned that Chris Paul would no longer be their teammate.

title: Messi still noncommittal about 2026 World Cup
content: In an interview with ESPN, Lionel Messi stopped short of definitively confirming he would play at the 2026 World Cup.

title: 'All-time Raven' Andrews secures 3-year extension
content: The Ravens rewarded Mark Andrews with a three-year, $39.3 million extension, locking in the franchise leader in receptions, receiving yards and touchdown catches.

title: Barnwell's end of the year prove-it list: 17 NFL coaches and players with something at stake
content: Kenneth Walker III, Jonathan Gannon, Shedeur Sanders and Matt Eberflus are among those with a lot to gain -- or lose -- over the season's final five weeks.

title: Week 14 buzz: What we're hearing on Bryce Young, Shedeur Sanders and more
content: Will Carolina extend Bryce Young? Could Cleveland stick with Sanders in 2026? Here's the latest intel.

title: 'A self-inflicted wound': Why Ole Miss finally had enough of Lane Kiffin
content: How the long courtship of the Rebels coach finally came to a head, amid secret meetings and middle fingers.

title: A final farewell to Lane Kiffin and the rest of the Bottom 10
content: With the season over and the final votes tallied, we crown the best of the worst -- on and off the field.

title: 'I'm a Tiger 'til I die': Why Flau'jae Johnson returned for one last run at LSU
content: Flau'jae Johnson could have left for the WNBA. Instead, she came back for a final season to give LSU all she has left.

title: Three free agents to invest in -- and three to avoid
content: A bargain starting pitcher? Steer clear of Eugenio Suarez? Here are players to target and to be wary of.

title: How did Ohio State's Julian Sayin get so accurate? QB H-O-R-S-E
content: Sayin enters the Big Ten championship game on the verge of breaking the FBS completion percentage record.

title: NHL Awards Watch: MacKinnon jumps to massive lead in MVP race
content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races -- and some clear favorites have emerged.

title: A week to save his job? Is Slot under serious pressure at Liverpool now?
content: Liverpool have suffered nine defeats and a draw in their past 14 games in all competitions. Is it time for manager Arne Slot to go?

title: How one minute at Liverpool ruined Harvey Elliott's World Cup hopes
content: Elliott played one minute for Liverpool and isn't playing at Aston Villa. He can't make another transfer now.

title: Indiana freshman defies death, makes NCAA volleyball tournament
content: Toxic shock syndrome nearly killed Charlotte Vinson. Now she's hoping to help Indiana advance at the NCAA tournament.

title: Power Rankings: Michigan leaps to No. 1, plus 5 new faces
content: The Wolverines had perhaps the best Feast Week to take them over Arizona and Purdue in a roller-coaster No. 1 race.

title: ACC/SEC Women's Challenge guide: Can ACC make up ground after disappointing first month?
content: Can the ACC make noise when LSU-Duke, Notre Dame-Ole Miss, UNC-Texas and more meet on Wednesday and Thursday?

title: Signing day 2026: Virginia Tech raids Penn State, Houston, Vandy go big and more
content: The 2026 recruiting cycle is almost finished. Here's how this class will impact college football next season.

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Week 14
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Week 14 decisions: Start Watson and Monangai? Trust Jefferson, Saquon and Lamar?
content: Players trending up to add for the playoffs and what to do with three stars headed in the wrong direction.

title: 'We came to see Otis': Temptations' Otis Williams reflects on Marvin Gaye and Lions ahead of TNF performance
content: The founder of the Temptations gave a glimpse into what fans can expect in their historic Detroit Lions performance, along with special moments that intersected soul and the Lions.

title: One thing to know about 2026 World Cup qualified teams ahead of draw
content: The FIFA World Cup draw is happening Friday, and 42 of the 48 teams are confirmed. But what's one thing you need to know about each nation?

title: Lionel Messi exclusive: Argentina star talks World Cup, Inter Miami, more
content: Lionel Messi sits down for a lengthy interview with ESPN, discussing his desire to again lead Argentina, the brilliance of Lionel Scaloni and why Pep Guardiola is one of "the best" ever.

title: Proposed power to EC to hold simultaneous polls is not excessive, Law Commission tells House panel
content: During the briefing, members said the law panel also noted that the Constitution amendment Bill did not require ratification by at least 50% of the State Assemblies to come into force

title: Prashant Bhushan blames EC for lack of transparency in SIR process
content: He argued that although EC’s press notices had indicated the number of claims and objections received, these were not made available online in the required ‘clickable’ format, that is, a format by which the forms could be accessed by clicking on the entry in the list.

title: IndiGo says flight delays and cancellations to continue for next two or three days
content: 280 flights cancelled across five major airports; airline officials meet Civil Aviation Minister, say flights will be curtailed from December 8; seek exemption from night flying rules till February 10

title: Madras High Court stalls release of Karthi-starrer Vaa Vaathiyar
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar grant the interim order following a petition filed by the Official Assignee of the High Court in case related to insolvent businessman Arjunlal Sunderdas case

title: Supreme Court declines to halt ‘illegal’ demolitions in Bareilly, asks residents to approach High Court
content: When petitioners’ counsel insisted that the authorities are “standing with bulldozers” and that further demolition is imminent, Bench agreed to grant limited interim protection

title: Visakhapatnam researchers document unique predatory behaviour of horn-eyed ghost crab
content: The sighting at Rushikonda sheds new light on a species believed to stay confined to sandy intertidal zones

title: Cannot interfere in panchayat poll process, says HC
content: Courts cannot interfere with the process of elections once the notification is issued, as per Article 243-O of the Constitution, the HC noted

title: J&K govt. sends revised reservation quota proposal for L-G’s approval
content: In March 2024, the L-G had approved 10% reservation for newly included tribes, including Paharis, as Scheduled Tribes, and added 15 new castes as Other Backward Classes

title: On VC appointments, Governor agrees to name objected to by Kerala CM
content: Affidavit in Supreme Court says CM Vijayan opposed one candidate based on news reports, not official records

title: Private sector participation in defence, aerospace sector on rise
content: New opportunities such as air taxis and air ambulances are emerging which are witnessing private sector participation. Many job opportunities are emerging in aviation sector and many new courses need to be introduced to cater to these market needs, TSCHE Chairman said

title: Campaign enters final lap in Eloor municipality
content: An industrial town with a host of issues, including air and water pollution, the civic body is expected to witness a keen contest this time as the Congress-led UDF has tried to quell the factionalism that had long marred its chances of coming to power

title: Urbanisation, migration contribute to voter roll irregularities: Law Minister
content: Meghwal said significant changes have occurred in the electoral roll over the last 20 years due to additions and deletions on a large scale

title: NEET has commercialised education: Congress MP
content: The current practice was ‘flawed’ as it focused on only ‘single stakes exams’ that benefited only the rich, the coaching mafia and dummy schools, says Virudhunagar MP Manickam Tagore in Lok Sabha

title: NITI Aayog’s Quantum tech roadmap, Telangana Quantum Strategy unveiled
content: India has a rare opportunity to shape the trajectory of a foundational technology, says GoI’s think tank; State leaders reiterate Telangana’s commitment to be at the forefront

title: CRDA gives nod for LPS-2, construction of Lok Bhavan in Amaravati
content: It resolves to raise a loan of ₹7,380 crore from NABARD for infrastructure creation in the capital; CM tells officials to install an iconic statue of N.T. Rama Rao at Neerukonda as a symbol of Telugu self-respect and glory

title: 4.80 crore cases pending in lower courts across India, Law Minister tells Rajya Sabha
content: Arjun Ram Meghwal says there are 297 vacancies in various High Courts; total number of vacant posts of judges in district courts is 4,855

title: 18 Maoists killed in Bijapur anti-Naxal operation
content: The 16 Maoists identified carried a total bounty of ₹1.3 crore, and included PLGA company commander Modiyami Vella; he was allegedly involved in 44 attacks against politicians and security forces

title: MP Krishna Devarayalu raises A.P. tobacco farmers’ plight in Parliament
content: He also accuses ITC and GPI companies of not doing enough to mitigate the woes of the growers through CSR initiatives

title: Supreme Court to review clause in 2025 Order that contradicts Assam Accord
content: Bench led by CJI seeks Centre’s response on plea challenging provision allowing undocumented migrants to stay in Assam

title: 13th SIPB meet clears investments worth ₹20,444 crore in A.P.
content: Total investments cleared so far reaches ₹8.29 lakh crore; Chief Minister tells officials to ensure that foundations are laid for the projects for which MoUs were signed in the CII Partnership Summit within 45 days

title: Transfer rumors, news: Six Premier League giants eye Rodrygo move
content: Real Madrid winger Rodrygo would consider joining Arsenal, Liverpool, Manchester City, Manchester United, Chelsea and Tottenham. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: F1 finale: History haunts McLaren, beckons for Verstappen
content: At F1's season finale, McLaren's parallels to past heartbreaks are hard to ignore as Max Verstappen's long-shot title bid doesn't look so far fetched.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Collin Gillespie, Austin Reaves continue hot scoring runs
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players, like Collin Gillespie, Trae Young and more.

title: Call for advanced medical innovations in veterinary sector
content: Multidisciplinary research is need of the hour to bring new innovations for animal health and productivity, says Dr. D.V.R. Prakash Rao, chairperson and managing director of Chennai-based Prakash Foods & Feed Mills

title: A year after Sandhya Theatre stampede, young survivor struggles with only 5% recovery
content: The family had sought financial assistance from film industry representatives 15 days ago but received a response only on Thursday

title: Karur Collector appears again before CBI for inquiry in stampede case
content: Several doctors attached to the government hospitals in the neighbouring districts, who were involved in post-mortem of the bodies, appeared before the CBI officials for questioning.

title: Congress suppressed multiple complaints against Mamkootathil: Govindan
content: CPI(M) State secretary says Congress is run by a criminal mafia. He asserts that the LDF is set for strong victory in local body polls

title: Naidu misusing institutions to absolve himself of corruption cases, alleges Jagan
content: Accusing the NDA government of implementing ‘Red Book constitution’ driven by vindictive politics and nepotism, the YSRCP chief vows to fight the battle through courts

title: DDO offices will strengthen growth, welfare programmes at field level, says Dy. CM
content: Pawan Kalyan virtually launches the offices across State; says NDA govt. is committed to realising Mahatma Gandhi’s dream of 'Gram Swaraj' and is introducing structural reforms to ensure decentralised governance and stronger local institutions

title: Eenchakkal flyover construction: night traffic restrictions from Friday
content: Traffic arrangements will be in place on the Chakka-Thiruvallam road from 11 p.m. to 5 a.m. from December 5 to December 16

title: HC denies anticipatory bail to two former TDB officials in Sabarimala gold theft case
content: Anticipatory bail applications moved by S. Sreekumar, former administrative officer of TDB and S. Jayasree, former secretary of the board

title: Postal department mulls system for UPI-like “labels” for physical addresses
content: The system, called DHRUVA, will provide users a convenient way to share their addresses with various platforms; a draft legal amendment has been published for public comment

title: Cabinet approves Karnataka Hate Speech and Hate Crimes (Prevention) Bill to prevent promotion of hate speech
content: The Bill to be tabled in the Winter session of the State legislature in Belagavi proposes punishment for hate crime, including imprisonment from one to seven years and a fine of ₹50,000

title: Outcry as police insist on strict virtual queue timings at Sabarimala
content: Police advisory says turning up on a different day than the day for which the token has been created leads to crowd-management issues at the Sannidhanam. A total 15 lakh devotees visit temple in 18 days

title: Kerala and A.P. civil supplies officials discuss best practices, potential collaboration
content: The visiting team calls on Andhra Pradesh Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar, who has underlined the need for knowledge-sharing and inter-State cooperation to ensure better service delivery to the citizens

title: 88% of Polavaram project works completed, says Minister
content: The construction works on the diaphragm wall have reached 950 metres, achieving 75% progress, says Nimmala Rama Naidu after inspecting key construction components

title: GBA working on ward reservation roster for civic polls; OBC activists say ‘triple test’ not followed
content: Karnataka Damanita Hindulida Jaatigala Okkuta has urged the government to form a dedicated commission to identify ‘politically backward’ communities and recommend a new formula for reservation in local bodies

title: Jagan spreading falsehood on farmers’ welfare, says Andhra Pradesh Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar
content: While a 75-kg bag of paddy fetched up to ₹1,650 during YSRCP term, the NDA government has raised the MSP to ₹1,792, ensuring better returns, asserts Manohar

title: 3,258 Indians deported from U.S. in 2025, highest since 2009
content: Jaishankar tells Rajya Sabha India has raised concerns over U.S. deportation policies and treatment of detainees

title: Smriti wedding postponed: Palak Muchhal breaks silence on 'tough times'
content: Smriti Mandhana and music composer Palash Muchhal’s wedding, scheduled for November 23, was postponed after health-related issues in the family.

title: Putin-Modi meet: How India became Russia's lifeline - but on its own terms
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in New Delhi for a crucial summit with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking to bolster energy and arms ties amidst Western sanctions. India navigates a diplomatic tightrope, balancing its historical partnership with Moscow against growing ties with Washington, aiming for strategic autonomy.

title: US eases curbs on Lukoil outlets outside Russia; exemption valid till April 2026
content: US authorities have temporarily eased sanctions on Lukoil-branded fuel stations outside Russia, allowing them to operate until April 2026. This move impacts stations in the US and elsewhere, while India faces a significant drop in Russian crude imports due to sanctions on Lukoil and Rosneft, impacting major refiners.

title: Rupee slide: RBI lets currency weaken amid outflows; focus shifts to curbing speculation
content: India's central bank is allowing the rupee to weaken due to slowing dollar inflows, widening trade pressures, and heavy foreign selling. The Reserve Bank of India is shifting focus from defending specific exchange rates to preventing disorderly movements, as the rupee becomes Asia's worst-performing currency this year.

title: 'Absolutely filthy': Lyon roars after being dropped from Gabba Test
content: Australia opted for an all-pace attack for the Brisbane Test, leaving out Lyon. The team made two changes from the eight-wicket win in the opening Test in Perth. Michael Neser came in for Lyon, and Josh Inglis replaced injured opener Usman Khawaja. Lyon said he got to know about his omission only after reaching the ground.

title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife cut her Amazon stake to donate millions of dollars
content: MacKenzie Scott, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife, has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief. Scott's philanthropic efforts continue to impact numerous causes, solidifying her position as a top global philanthropist.

title: Moscow callback: When Modi first met Putin; photos from 2001 go viral
content: As President Putin prepares for a visit to India, old images of him with Prime Minister Modi from 2001 have resurfaced. Then Gujarat Chief Minister Modi accompanied PM Vajpayee to Moscow, marking his first international engagement and early diplomatic interaction with Putin. The visit fostered cooperation between Gujarat and Russia's Astrakhan region.

title: Leon Draisaitl’s status vs Kraken unclear as Oilers await game-time call
content: Leon Draisaitl’s status is the major storyline as the Edmonton Oilers prepare to host the Seattle Kraken tonight at Rogers Place. The star forward has been central to Edmonton’s offensive success this season, and his availability carries major implications for the matchup. With both teams pushing for early-December momentum, this game shapes up as a crucial Western Conference showdown.

title: Organisers move Syed Mushtaq fixture after unusual crowd surge for Hardik Pandya
content: A Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match between Baroda and Gujarat was moved to a larger stadium due to security concerns arising from large crowds gathering to watch Hardik Pandya. Pandya, returning from an injury, bowled well and contributed with the bat as Baroda secured an eight-wicket victory.

title: Kobe Bryant slammed by alleged friend, claims he 'wasn’t a good person'
content: New claims suggest NBA legend Kobe Bryant was not a good person and neglected family and friends. An alleged childhood friend shared disappointment over unmet promises of support. This contrasts with Kobe's documented generosity and mentorship. The allegations have sparked debate online, highlighting the complex nature of his legacy. Kobe's life included both personal challenges and significant positive contributions.

title: Travis Kelce’s bold Europe comments on Taylor Swift spark future rumors
content: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: Quinn Hughes linked to Red Wings, Devils as Canucks face uncertainty
content: NHL trade rumors continue to swirl around Vancouver Canucks defenseman Quinn Hughes. As the team’s difficult season fuels outside interest. Insiders have identified the Detroit Red Wings and New Jersey Devils as potential suitors. Along with roster assets, family connections, and long-term planning, all contribute to growing speculation across the NHL landscape.

title: Celina Jaitly shares update on brother Major Vikrant detained in UAE
content: Celina Jaitly pens an emotional note giving an update on her brother Major Vikrant Jaitly who has been detained in the USA since September 2024. The actress drops update after the Delhi High Court's order to facilitate communication with her brother.

title: What your poop says about your health (and why you should actually look at it)
content: Your poop is basically a daily health report, and the clues are all there, shape, colour, smell, consistency, and how often you go. Paying attention without spiralling into panic is the sweet spot: some stool changes are normal, while others are your body waving a bright red flag.

title: RBI confirms final payout for 2017 gold bond series; long-term holders gain over 340%
content: A decade-old Sovereign Gold Bond investment has yielded over four times its initial value, with a Rs 1 lakh stake now worth more than Rs 4.4 lakh. The Reserve Bank of India announced the final redemption price for the 2017-18 Series-X tranche, which matured after eight years. Investors also benefited from a 2.

title: Exclusive: From 'Dying from spice' to 'iPhone revolt': Dutch No.1 opens box of not-quite-chess tales
content: Anish Giri found a crucial turning point in his chess career during the Global Chess League (GCL) last year, overcoming a dip in form and confidence. He shares humorous anecdotes about team bonding, food preferences, and even a playful "iPhone mutiny." Giri sees the upcoming GCL season as a vital warm-up for the FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championships.

title: Amon-Ra St. Brown injury: Will Lions star play vs Cowboys tonight?
content: Amon-Ra St. Brown's availability for Thursday Night Football is uncertain after an ankle injury, posing a significant challenge for the Detroit Lions. His potential absence, alongside Penei Sewell's questionable status, could severely impact the offensive line against a formidable Dallas Cowboys defense, with major playoff seeding implications on the line.

title: Nifty50, Sensex soar but broad market weak; most Nifty500 stocks below trend averages
content: Despite Nifty 50 and Sensex reaching record highs, broad market optimism is limited as nearly half of NSE's top 500 stocks lag key technical benchmarks. Only 40% of Nifty 500 stocks are above their 50-day SMA, indicating weak market breadth driven by large-cap gains. Retail investors remain cautious, with many mid and small-cap stocks still significantly below prior peaks.

title: 'Despite geopolitical uncertainty': Rajnath hails ties with Russia; message for Trump?
content: India's Defence Minister Rajnath Singh reaffirmed the nation's steady defence partnership with Russia, despite global geopolitical uncertainty. The remarks were made during the 22nd India-Russia Inter-Governmental Commission meeting, just before President Putin's arrival for the Annual Summit. Both ministers emphasized the strong, long-standing ties and ongoing cooperation across military and economic domains.

title: Bomb threat to nuclear plant: Search ops launched; email mentions Putin visit
content: Security agencies launched an extensive search operation in Ajmer, Rajasthan, following a bomb threat email claiming RDX-based explosives were planted at the Ajmer Sharif dargah, district collectorate, and Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant. The email warned of detonation coinciding with Russian President Vladimir Putin's arrival. Premises were evacuated and thoroughly checked, with no suspicious objects found so far.

title: 'Agar Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma ka dimaag ... ': Ravi Shastri's bold warning
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri has strongly defended Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma against doubts about their ODI future. He emphasised that players of their stature should not be questioned, stating that if they perform, their critics will quickly fade away. Shastri's remarks come amid discussions about India's long-term team planning for the 2027 World Cup.

title: Sushma Swaraj's husband Swaraj Kaushal passes away; PM condoles death
content: Swaraj Kaushal, former Mizoram Governor and husband of the late Sushma Swaraj, passed away at 73 after a brief illness. He was a senior advocate with a distinguished public and legal career. His daughter, MP Bansuri Swaraj, expressed profound grief, finding solace in his reunion with her mother. Leaders mourned his contributions.

title: Putin’s India visit: Trade in focus as New Delhi looks to reduce deficit
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to India aims to significantly boost economic cooperation, with New Delhi seeking to reduce its trade deficit and expand market access for Indian goods like pharmaceuticals and agricultural products. The trip, accompanied by a large business delegation, is expected to yield agreements in shipping, healthcare, and connectivity, alongside a long-term economic roadmap until 2030.

title: New gratuity rules: How will your payout increase at various salary levels? Explained
content: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, broaden the definition of 'wages,' potentially increasing gratuity payouts for employees. Fixed-term employees now qualify for gratuity after one year of service. Employers face increased financial liabilities, with clarity needed on past service calculations.

title: Rupee rebounds: RBI support, softer dollar offer relief; currency now 89.96 vs $
content: The rupee recovered from its record low, closing at 89.96 against the US dollar after a softer dollar index and reported RBI intervention. Despite initial weakness due to foreign selling and trade deal delays, the currency found support. Analysts anticipate continued pressure from outflows but potential cushioning from a subdued dollar and possible RBI actions.

title: Warriors linked to $27M Mavericks star as support for Curry; Hield seen as key asset
content: Golden State Warriors and Dallas Mavericks are reportedly considering a straightforward trade: Buddy Hield for Naji Marshall. This move addresses roster imbalances, with the Warriors seeking defensive wing depth and the Mavericks aiming to boost floor spacing around their stars. Both teams could benefit from a fresh start and improved team dynamics.

title: MLB trade rumors: Cubs poised to land $400M Tigers Cy Young winner in mega deal
content: The Chicago Cubs are reportedly considering a blockbuster trade for Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, a two-time Cy Young winner, to fill the void left by Kyle Tucker's expected free agency departure. This move would create a formidable pitching duo with rookie Cade Horton and signal a serious World Series push for the Cubs.

title: 'No one had more skin than me': Root's century big relief for Hayden; here's why
content: Joe Root finally ended his long wait for a Test century in Australia, reaching the milestone at the Gabba. This achievement brought relief to former Australian opener Matthew Hayden, who had publicly vowed to "walk nude around the MCG" if Root failed to score a hundred on the tour. Root reached the milestone in 181 balls.

title: 'Up to delegation': Govt counters Rahul's Putin meet claim; BJP piles on
content: Government sources have refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims that opposition leaders are barred from meeting foreign dignitaries. They stated that the Ministry of External Affairs facilitates official meetings, while engagements outside this framework are at the visitor's discretion. Several foreign leaders have met Gandhi since he became Leader of the Opposition, including Prime Ministers from Bangladesh, Malaysia, Mauritius, and New Zealand.

title: 'Akhanda 2' review: Balakrishna shines in action film as box office expectations peak
content: Nandamuri Balakrishna returns as the lead in 'Akhanda 2: Thandavam', set for a December 5, 2025 release. Early reviews hail it as a mass action entertainer, praising Balakrishna's awe-inspiring entry, intense sequences, and mind-blowing Hanuman entry. The film promises a blend of fiction, action, and large-scale mass scenes, with high box office expectations following the success of its predecessor.

title: Ashes: Joe Root ends century drought, scores first-ever hundred in Australia
content: Root reached the milestone in 181 balls, batting through a phase when England needed stability and control, and in the process, checked off one of the few achievements missing from his record.

title: From Rs 43K tickets to 10-hr delays: Flight disruptions continue - key points
content: IndiGo faces a nationwide operational crisis with widespread flight cancellations and delays, leaving lakhs of passengers stranded and sparking anger. The DGCA has summoned the airline's management to explain the "unprecedented disruptions" and present a plan to stabilize operations during the peak travel season.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal slips; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold prices dipped on Thursday amid mixed global trends and weak US economic data, while silver futures saw gains. Investors are cautiously awaiting key US inflation data for clarity on the Federal Reserve's monetary policy. Geopolitical tensions also contributed to a risk premium for precious metals.

title: 'Where is Shami? Why isn't he playing?': Harbhajan fumes after India's defeat
content: Harbhajan Singh urges India to win without Jasprit Bumrah after South Africa's historic 359 chase. He suggests recalling Varun Chakaravarthy to the ODI squad, emphasizing the need for match-winners in shorter formats. The series is now tied 1-1 heading into the decider.

title: 'Govt doesn't want us to meet': Rahul's big charge amid Putin's India visit; Tharoor agrees
content: Hours before Russia President Putin's arrival, Rahul Gandhi criticized the Modi government for breaking the tradition of allowing the Leader of Opposition to meet foreign dignitaries. He stated this practice, observed under Vajpayee and Manmohan Singh, is now ignored due to government insecurity. Putin's visit will focus on trade, technology, and regional issues, with several agreements expected.

title: 'Targeted kids better looking than hers': Scary confessions of 'serial killer' mom
content: A chilling child murder spree has been uncovered in Haryana, with a 34-year-old woman, Poonam, confessing to drowning at least four children, including her own toddler son. Driven by an urge to kill children more attractive than her own, she meticulously staged the deaths as accidents. The latest victim was a six-year-old girl at a wedding.

title: Women's Power Rankings: Texas unseats UConn at No. 1 after big wins
content: the Players Era Championship in Las Vegas last week prompted a new no. 1 in ESPN's Power Rankings . the gamecocks and longhorns met four times in 2024-25: twice in the regular season, in the SEC tournament final and the national semifinals, with South Carolina winning three of the four . it's not the first time South Carolina coach Dawn Staley and Texas coach Vic Schaefer have been part of a rivalry .

title: ACC/SEC Challenge guide: The best games, from Duke, Arkansas, more
content: the 2025 ACC/SEC Men's Challenge featured a bevy of AP top 25 men's college basketball teams . on Tuesday, the ACC came out swinging, with no. 4 Duke escaping an attempted double-digit comeback by no. 15 Florida by a single point . a one-possession victory for no. 16 North Carolina over no. 18 Kentucky ended the night up 6-2 on the SEC .

title: Jets' Gotham City 'Rivalries' uniform debut tops NFL Week 14 looks
content: the threads are part of the new "Rivalries" series unveiled this season . it's the first uniform combination in franchise history with a brown helmet . the new york Jets will debut their "Gotham City Football" uniforms against the Miami Dolphins .

title: All the news, flips and top moments from the early signing day
content: DT Lamar Brown, the no. 1 overall ESPN 300 recruit, explains his decision to not sign yet after verbally committing to LSU earlier this year . college football's early signing period started Wednesday and runs until Friday . if a prospect doesn't sign a national letter of intent by Friday, the next national signing day for this cycle .

title: UFC 323 expert picks, best bets: Can Merab or Pantoja be stopped?
content: merab Dvalishvili will defend his bantamweight title for the fourth time this year . the nine-year veteran from the country of Georgia is taking on former champion Petr Yan . if he gets his hand raised for the 15th consecutive time on Saturday, he'll become the first UFC fighter to win four title fights in a calendar year. pound-for-pound competitor, Alexandre Pantoja (30-5), puts his men's flyweight belt on the line in the co-

title: What now for Paul and the Clippers? We answered six questions on the stunning news
content: Chris Paul and the LA Clippers are parting ways with him overnight . the 40-year-old point guard had signed with the Clippers on a one-year deal in July . he had not been on speaking terms with coach Ty Lue for several weeks .

title: Rating Portugal kit for Ronaldo's final World Cup, other Puma jerseys

title: Ranking Saturday's fights: Roach-Cruz, Foster-Fulton, more
content: lamont Roach and Isaac "Pitbull" Cruz fight for vacant WBC interim title at 140 pounds . sportsmail runs through the best fights to watch this weekend, from San Antonio to Monte Carlo to the gold coast in Queensland, Australia . a rematch with Gervonta "Tank" Davis failed to happen .

title: US to scan social media of all H-1B, H-4 visa applicants from December 15

title: Who has the most work to do? Where all 30 MLB teams stand ahead of winter meetings
content: the focus is shifting to every team's retooling effort for 2026 . it's going to have a tough act to follow . the heavy lifting of this hot stove season still lies ahead . for now, we'll check in with our first offseason stock watch .

title: 'He ain't leaving': Inside George Pickens' breakout season and future in Dallas
content: a.Q. Shipley and darius Butler break down the Dallas Cowboys' successful offense with players like George Pickens . pickens was a second-round pick in 2022 . he's a child, one Steelers source says .

title: 🏈 CFP Bubble Watch: Could the ACC get left out?
content: if the ACC beats Virginia, it's not guaranteed a spot in the 12-team field . it could open the door for two conference champions to compete for a national title . at no. 12, the Hurricanes still need some help, but Alabama increased its chances .

title: Week 15 preview: A look at Championship Week matchups and players to watch
content: if the playoff has taken some of the shine off a championship trophy, there will still be plenty of action this weekend with high stakes . in the big 12, BYU hopes to avenge its only loss -- a blowout to Texas Tech -- and steal a playoff bid . the conference's best team -- Miami -- won't take the field .
